Articles.Content:
hello, I just wanted some name suggestions for a long term moon lander mission. I'll see how many moons I can reach in the kerbol system with a orbital ship-lander hybrid. It has a drill and ISRU converter to refuel with each stop. I'll link a photo. I just wanted to see what the KSP community thought of it. Thanks!![94DrxUX.jpg?1](%5Bimg%5Dhttp%3A//i.imgur.com/94DrxUX.jpg?1)

![ihVQMxi.png](%5Bimg%5Dhttp%3A//i.imgur.com/ihVQMxi.png)

That's one hefty lander ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) What TWR and how much dV it carries? As for the name: Barbican ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

MÃƒÂ¼nbÃƒÂ¼g ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif), good looking, wish you a soft landing!

If it fails to do so just EVA and descend with the Jetpack thrusters, make a rescue mission with MÃƒÂ¼nbÃƒÂ¼g II ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif), happy landings!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-07T18:51:16Z" title="08/07/2015 06:51  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 7, 2015</time> by Mikki**

> 
> That's one hefty lander ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) What TWR and how much dV it carries? As for the name: Barbican ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

It can get off the ground just fine. I have a whole bunch of mods and the engines I'm using have 207 m/s of thrust ASl. 1242 m/s combined. Very powerful engines for their size! TWR is 1.4 on Kerbin, 8 on the mun. No idea what the dV is. I'm more of a trial and error sort of person ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

**"The Shmoo!"**

![Shmoo_by_NickDraw.jpg](http://pedestriantv-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/article/2010/05/20/Shmoo_by_NickDraw.jpg)

Copied from wikipedia

A shmoo is shaped like a plump [bowling pin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bowling_pin) with stubby legs. It has smooth skin, eyebrows and sparse whiskersÃ¢â‚¬â€but no arms, nose or ears. Its feet are short and round but dextrous, as the shmoo's [comic book](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comic_book) adventures make clear. It has a rich gamut of facial expressions and often expresses love by exuding hearts over its head. [Cartoonist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cartoonist) Al Capp ascribed to the shmoo the following curious characteristics. His [satirical](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satirical) intent should be evident:

- They [reproduce asexually](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asexual_reproduction) and are incredibly prolific, multiplying exponentially faster than rabbits. They require no sustenance other than air.
- Shmoos are delicious to eat, and are eager to be eaten. If a human looks at one hungrily, it will happily immolate itself Ã¢â‚¬â€ either by jumping into a frying pan, after which they [taste like chicken](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taste_like_chicken), or into a broiling pan, after which they taste like steak. When roasted they taste like pork, and when baked they taste like catfish. (Raw, they taste like [oysters](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oyster) on the half-shell.)
- They also produce eggs (neatly packaged), milk (bottled, grade-A), and butterÃ¢â‚¬â€no churning required. Their pelts make perfect bootleather or house timber, depending on how thick you slice it.
- They have no bones, so there's absolutely no waste. Their eyes make the best [suspender](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suspenders) buttons, and their [whiskers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vibrissae) make perfect toothpicks. In short, they are simply the perfect ideal of a subsistence agricultural herd animal.
- Naturally gentle, they require minimal care, and are ideal playmates for young children. The frolicking of shmoon is so entertaining (such as their staged "shmoosical comedies") that people no longer feel the need to watch television or go to the [movies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Film).
- Some of the more tasty varieties of shmoo are more difficult to catch. Usually shmoo hunters, now a sport in some parts of the country, utilize a paper bag, flashlight and stick to capture their shmoos. At night the light stuns them, then they can be whacked in the head with the stick and put in the bag for frying up later on.

Basically they do everything well ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) a fine omen for your craft

PotRoast III.

Why?

No reason. I find myself naming my ships after food with random preceding numerals quite often.

My most recent SSTO was the Kidney Bean Mk.V
With that ship design, its function, and the ambition of your plans? It can only be the *Moon-a-tick*! Or some variant spelling thereof.
Smash the keyboard until you get something interesting. It's what I do.

Moonhoper

Because that's what you want to do.

At night the light stuns them, then they can be whacked in the head with the stick and put in the bag for frying up later on.

http://pedestriantv-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/article/2010/05/20/Shmoo_by_NickDraw.jpg

Well gosh. I wouldn't want to eat the gentle creature would I? he looks so happy!
Given your username, I suggest various versions of "Chick Pea", or maybe "Hummus?"

> 
> Given your username, I suggest various versions of "Chick Pea", or maybe "Hummus?"

haha!
